lines.text: [after being shocked by eavesdropping on Dr. Daniel and hearing that the "Cassandra Project" is being shut down, Max is shocked again when he is unexpectedly contacted by an approaching spaceship]
Mayday, Mayday! This is SERP Neptune 425946. Do you read me? This is SERP Neptune 425946. Do you read me? Over!

[in wonder]
That's a woman's voice!
Mayday! We have a Mayday! This is SERP Neptune 425946. Do you read me? Over!

[transmitting]
This is, uh, UL-C53 Station to SERP Neptune, I- I- I read you. What is your Mayday? Over.
We have sustained engine damage. Request permission to dock for repairs. Over.

[stunned]
Dock?
Do you read, UL-C53? Request permission to dock. Imperative! Over!
[Max is indecisive over whether to disturb Dr. Daniel]
Permission granted! Direct to pad coordinates Manx Terra Odin Godfrey Two. Do you read me? Over.
[Max waits anxiously for a response]

[transmitting]
Do you read coordinates? Over!
Yes, yes, I read you. Acknowledge for approaching Manx Terra Odin Godfrey Two. Do you read? Over.

[transmitting]
Yes, correct! This is fantastic!

[to herself]
"Fantastic"?
[after a fight against the authorities who wanted them dead, Maggie, Mendes, and Keller are all alive, but furious at each other]
Where the hell did *you* go?
Back off, Mendes. I took my man out!
Yeah, and left me with two more!

[backing up Keller, and lying, because she was the one who killed the guy]
Yeah, and he also took out the squid on the floor!
[Keller and Maggie exchange looks]

[lets go of Keller, but still sneering]
Big hero.
The show's over!

[indicating forward view scanner]
Take a look at this.
What is that?
[UL-C53 Station is displayed]
First stop. Better think up an alias, Mendes. Let's lose the bodies.
Right.
[Keller runs off the bridge to dispose of the police whom they've killed]
[Max welcomes the fugitives in from their spaceship]
Well, why don't I show you where you'll be staying?
[He leads them into a hall, and a siren goes off. Max turns it off]
I *hate* that alarm.
[He turns to see that the three fugitives are pointing blasters at him]

[unfazed and conciliatory]
No, that just means you're carrying weapons. There are no weapons allowed beyond this point. Maggie, the Doctor has *amazingly* strict rules about this.
[Looking at Maggie within the couple of minutes that he met her]
Your lips! They're, uh, quite full, aren't they?
embarrassment, shyness, appreciation, and realization that Max has never seen a woman before]
Now, let me get this straight. You've got a... what did you call it?
An android.
Right. That's, uh, like a robot, right?
That's correct.
And you want to hook me up to this robot and stimulate me.
Yes.
Stimulate like sex, right?
Yes.
Brother, you take the prize. That's the weirdest line for getting into my pants that I've ever heard, and I've heard 'em all. I mean, lunch was good, but it wasn't that good.
[Max enters the room where Maggie, Keller, and Mendes are arguing]
Excuse me. I thought you should know that that ship, the police ship, was alone. I've made a thorough check and there's nothing else in the sector. You have nothing to worry about.
[Max's smile fades when the others don't thank him]
Well, I thought you should know.
Wait a minute! *You* blew that ship?
Yes.
[smiling again]
I did. Oh, I almost forgot. There's an emergency signal box planted on your ship. That's how they found you. I think you should dismantle it. Right now.
How long have you been up here, Max?
Five years, seven months...
You need a change.
[puts her hands around his shoulders]
Yes! That's why I've gotta go with you!
You don't wanna hook up with us.
Why not?
Well, because we may not even make it back to Earth.
I'll take that chance.
Well, that's not the point!
[Her tone gentles]
I like you. I don't want you caught up in the same mess that I'm in. Mendes and Keller would eat you alive.
They haven't eaten you.
Well, I can handle them and you can't.
Maggie...
Look, I know how to get around them.
I know.
It's not a game, Max!
Maggie! This is my only chance. I'm to be phased out as soon as Cassandra's on her feet. Doctor'll probably turn me into a sprinkler-head for the greenhouse.
You *have* been up here too long.
[moves in to kiss him]
[Max is cleaning up the spilled food tray]
What kind of work do you do here, Max?
I'm Dr. Daniel's assistant, as I said.
[while Max looks at Keller, the tray slides across the floor into Max's hand by some unseen force]
[first lines]
[Max is listening to Huey Lewis while playing with miniature robots and watching a screen showing the very basics of humans kissing and making love]

[over the intercom]
Max.
[Max switches from the video to the scanners]
Max?
Yes, Dr. Daniel?
Max, what is that noise?
[Max turns off the music]
I was doing some research, Sir.
On what?

[sounding a bit panicky]
Earth. The twentieth century.
Have you logged in, Max?
Uh... no... but, I was...
Then do it now, Max, and make sure we have shut down for the night.
Yes, Sir.
I don't want to be disturbed.
Good night, Dr. Daniel.
Good night, Max.
Oh, and Doctor?
["Blip" sound. No answer. Max sighs before logging in]
Fifteen October, 2036, 0100 hour log-in. As usual... there's nothing to report. Radar reveals a Hermes CP-247... passing... as usual. And that's it.

[dispiritedly]
This is Max, signing out.
What the hell you doin'? Close the goddamned door!
Relax Mendes, we got them all.
There's *five* of them, you moron; we only got four.
Mendes! There's one behind you!
[Mendes whirls around and aims at... a body on the floor]

[calmly]
Meet Captain Popov.
I forgot to collect your weapon, Mr. uh... I- I didn't hear - get his...
Mr. Popov.

[angrily]
"Popov"?
[Keller fixes Mendes with a stern look to name tag on Mendes' uniform]
How do you do, Mr. Popov? Do - do you mind?
[Mendes smiles at Max, deactivates the blaster and gives it to Max, then takes out a second one and angles it toward Keller]
Come on.
[Mendes smiles again to Max and gives him the second blaster. Max steps away to lock the guns in a cabinet]

[warningly]
Bad move, Keller.
[Max is showing Maggie and Mendes the video center]
There's a wide variety of recreational tapes to choose from.
You've got any good porno strips?
What?
men and women.
Oh! Oh, you mean sexual instruction tapes.
[chuckles]
Well, as a matter of fact Mr. Popov...

[firmly]
*Don't* call me that.
